<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Order the given unit(s) to fire on the given target (without radio messages).

The target is set with [[doTarget]] or [[commandTarget]].

The target can be a unit or a vehicle, but not an object.</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName '''doFire''' target </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] or [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> target: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_ESoldier1 [[doFire]] _WSoldier1;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[fire]], [[commandFire]], [[canFire]], [[fireAtTarget]], [[forceWeaponFire]], [[commandArtilleryFire]], [[commandSuppressiveFire]], [[doArtilleryFire]], [[doSuppressiveFire]], [[isManualFire]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 3, 2006 - 14:31
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''

It is often helpful to use [[doTarget]] first.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 25, 2007 - 23:17
<dt class="note">[[User:Hurricane|Hurricane]]<dd class="note">

A unit will not execute this command when his behaviour is set to "careless".

<dd class="notedate">Posted on Feb 18, 2012 - 21:07
<dt class="note">[[User:Zingo|Zingo]]<dd class="note">

Board dofire not working in arma2 1.11. an entity he throws he shoots not only.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 7, 2012 - 14:05
<dt class="note">[[User:Sakura_Chan|Sakura_Chan]]<dd class="note">

Unitname dofire objnull does not work like it does in commandfire. Target var has to be real (Arma2 AO) might be different in other versions.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
